statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Marcus Posley sank four 3-pointers and scored 26 points to lead St. Bonaventure to an 84-68 comeback win over Richmond on Sunday.
article.headline: St. Bonaventure overtakes Richmond in 84-68 win
article.linkText: St. Bonaventure overtakes Richmond in 84-68 win
article.story: SAINT BONAVENTURE, N.Y. -- Marcus Posley sank four 3-pointers and scored 26 points to lead St. Bonaventure to an 84-68 comeback win over Richmond on Sunday. Dion Wright added 19 points while hauling in a career-high 14 rebounds and Jaylen Adams had 18 points for the Bonnies (13-6, 5-3 Atlantic 10), who hit 27 of 54 from the field to snap a three-game skid. Posley was 8 for 17 from the field and 4 of 8 from long range. Trailing by six at the break, St. Bonaventure scored the first 11 points of the second half as part of a 23-6 run that made it 56-45 with 10:40 to play. Posley hit two 3-pointers during the run, dropped in three layups and the Bonnies never trailed again. T.J. Cline's 20 points led four in double figures for Richmond (11-9, 3-5), which was held scoreless over the first five minutes of the second half.
